metadata.titel_preek: Judgment And Mercy At Palm Sunday

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus enters the city of Jerusalem (and the human soul) to offer a final chance of peace before judgment, ultimately moving toward Calvary to open a way for salvation through his own suffering and tears.

tekstueel_bewijs: He considers this Palm Sunday entry to be one last offering of himself
Jesus faced the city, offering it light and life

object.identificatie: Peace / Reconciliation / 'The things which belong unto thy peace'
tekstueel_bewijs: the things which belong unto thy peace
one final chance... to embrace his way
God is still on the throne
God's overseeing inspection and superintending examination

ontvanger.identificatie: The City / The Hearer / 'You and me'
tekstueel_bewijs: for your city, for mine, for you, for me
the love of God goes all of the way for us
Calvary is the hill of another chance

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin / Human Failure / History's Evils / The 'Midday Midnight' of Calvary
tekstueel_bewijs: fury of all hell will be loosed
slothfulness, an empty swagger, and slavery to every passing fad
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is characterized as 'all hell' and 'evil incarnate', requiring the death of the Son of God to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The hearer's response to the weeping Savior: a movement from a stony heart to a broken will and surrender.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer ('I')
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The hearer's action is presented as a direct reaction to the primary action of the Savior weeping.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want to enter into the spirit of gaiety.
You turned from the God of your fathers.
I throw my frail heart... at the weeping Son of God.

voorbeelden: There are hard duties... which must be met.
what you planned to do with those gifts.
We know now that not a week would pass.
a way is opened, and a highway.
Calvary is the hill of another chance.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Pouvoir' (Power/Possibility) created by Christ's tears and death, which overcomes the human lack of 'Savoir' (Knowing the things of peace).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the tension of S1/S2 (Palm Sunday) through the failure of ~S1 (Jerusalem's ignorance) to the resolution in ~S2 (Calvary as the 'other chance').
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved not by human effort, but by the 'tears of the Savior' which bridge the gap between judgment and mercy.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; judgment is described as an 'all-seeing eye' and 'awesome visitation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon contains strong calls to community and social responsibility, the 'engine' is theocentric. The resolution of the human predicament is found in the person and emotional/physical sacrifice of Jesus, not in human moral improvement.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: One wonders if slothfulness... are to be the fate of our black community

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: I throw my frail heart... at the weeping Son of God.
The old, pursuing, persisting love of God has not given up on you.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The sermon avoids 'Be like David' tropes, focusing instead on 'Behold the Savior'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Catharsis and surrender through the realization of being loved despite failure.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; the Savior's tears do the work that the hearer's will cannot.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical narrative of Palm Sunday to the personal application of the hearer's soul is seamless.
spanning_punten: The shift from social/national judgment to individual 'brokenness' is a slight jump in actantial focus.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Calvary is the hill of another chance... where the love of God goes all of the way for us.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on the 'affective' power of the Cross rather than a specific pneumatological endowment.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'fury of all hell' and 'brokenness'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the primary Subject of the salvific verbs. The hearer is positioned as the object of divine grief and the receiver of divine mercy.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: The hearer is briefly made the Subject of 'building community' in a way that feels like a heavy 'Devoir' (obligation).
identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Ensure the 'community building' is seen as a fruit of the 'melted heart'.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Link the 'circle that took him in' more explicitly to the 'circle' Christ drew at Calvary.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Strong emphasis on Savoir (Knowing) in the middle section.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly state that the weeping Savior provides the power to build the community he desires.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: The sermon correctly places the 'Secondary Program' (Human response) after the 'Primary Program' (Christ's sacrifice).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful example of theocentric preaching that uses emotional depth to anchor structural grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'tremble, tremble' imagery, Greimas reveals that the 'tears' function as a modal operator that changes the hearer's competence from 'stony' to 'broken'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Lucan context of the peace-entry; Greimas shows how the 'City' actant is transposed onto the 'Individual Soul' actant.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas highlights that the 'Opponent' is not just Rome or the Jews, but the 'cutoff point' of time/opportunity which Christ's Subject-action (weeping/dying) successfully delays or overcomes.

volledige_subject_lijst: Jesus (faces, considers, offers, moves, speaks, beholds, weeps)
God (is on the throne, made a statement, searches)
We/You (want, know, disappoint, turned away, fall short)
appendices.notities: The sermon is highly effective because it moves the hearer from a Subject of 'merriment' to an Opponent of 'sloth' and finally to a Receiver of 'tears'.
